articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Italian Delegation of Assemblymen
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Italian Delegation of Assemblymen

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Tuesday met and had a talk with the Italian delegation of assemblymen from different political parties headed by Mauro Del Vecchio, senator from the Democratic Party of Italy.
					
					 Mauro Del Vecchio recalled that the two countries have cooperated with each other in various fields since their establishment of diplomatic ties, stressing the Italian government would strive to develop the relations with the DPRK in the future, too.

articles.title: Reception Hosted by WPK for Italian Delegation
articles.content:
Reception Hosted by WPK for Italian Delegation

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea hosted a reception for an Italian delegation of assemblymen from different political parties at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the Italian delegation headed by Mauro Del Vecchio, senator from the Democratic Party of Italy, and a staff member of the Italian embassy in Pyongyang.
					
					 Secretary Kim Yong Il and other officials of the Central Committee of the WPK attended.
					
					 Kim Yong Il in his speech expressed thanks to the assemblymen from different political parties of Italy for their efforts to develop the bilateral relations.
					
					 He expressed belief that they would make more positive efforts for friendship between the two countries. 
					
					 Mauro Del Vecchio in his speech expressed deep thanks for big efforts for the delegation's successful visit. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly relations between Italy and the DPRK would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Bulgarian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Bulgarian President

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Rosen Plevneliev upon his election as president of Bulgaria.
					
					 The message wished the president success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Bulgaria would develop in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Antigua and Barbuda
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Antigua and Barbuda

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Winston Baldwin Spencer, prime minister of Antigua and Barbuda, on the 30th anniversary of its independence.
					
					 The message wished him success in his efforts for the development and prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Kuwaiti FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates Kuwaiti FM

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a congratulatory message to Sheikh Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah on his appointment as deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait.
					
					 Expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished him success in his new job for the development of the country's external relations.

articles.title: Educationist Delegation Leaves for China
articles.content:
Educationist Delegation Leaves for China

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- An educationist delegation headed by Pak Sun Dok, vice-minister of General Education of the Education Commission, left here today to visit China.
					
					 The delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Post and Telecommunications headed by Vice-Minister Kim Yong Gil returned home on Tuesday after attending the 2011 world telecommunication exhibition in Switzerland.
					
					 The delegation for the Relations with Korean Peninsula of the European Parliament headed by Chairman Christian Ehler and the delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea led by Masatake Shinzato, chief of Okinawa Prefecture of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism, left here on the same day.

articles.title: Day of 7 Billion People Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Day of 7 Billion People Observed in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Diverse events were held at Yanggakdo International Hotel in Pyongyang on Monday, the Day of 7 Billion People. 
					
					 Present at the events were DPRK officials concerned, staff members of the UN organizations and foreign embassies in the DPRK, including Jerome Sauvage, UN resident coordinator and UNFPA representative. 
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made there. 
					
					 Speakers said 7 Billion Actions Campaign would have provided a good opportunity to better understand the importance of population issues in DPRK and promote the implementation of ICPD Plan of Action.  They expressed the belief that cooperation between the DPRK and the United Nations Population Fund will develop in a more favorable way in the future. 
					
					 Then a photo and children's painting exhibition and a prize-giving ceremony took place on the theme "The world at 7 Billion.
					
					 Paintings reflect not only the desire of children for a peaceful, environment-clean and prosperous world but also their willingness to contribute to the well-being of humankind. 
					
					The participants appreciated a video "United World", a song sang by artistes of different nations, before listening to speeches titled "Presentation of 2011 world population report" and "On DPRK population."

articles.title: 15th National School Youth Individual Art Contest
articles.content:
15th National School Youth Individual Art Contest

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The 15th national school youth and children's individual art contest took place at Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory from Oct. 25 to Nov. 1.
					
					 The annual event offers a good opportunity for finding out future artistes possessed of good talents and ability among school youth and children.
					
					 Attending it were 160 students who were selected at the first and second preliminary contests in provinces (municipalities).
					
					 It was divided into sectors of vocal music and national instrumental music.
					
					 The contesters fully showed their artistic talents which they have brought into full bloom while training themselves under the benevolence of the socialist educational system.

articles.title: Mongolian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Mongolian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here did friendship work at the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Jongbang Co-op Farm, Sariwon City in North Hwanghae Province on Tuesday.
					
					 They helped the farmers threshing.
					
					 The ambassador hoped the Korean farmers would register further success through their devoted labor.
					
					 The staff members handed the materials to the farm

articles.title: Top Prize of Int'l Festival Awarded to Aerial Stunt of DPRK
articles.content:
Top Prize of Int'l Festival Awarded to Aerial Stunt of DPRK

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Aerial stunt "Conquerors" of the Pyongyang Circus won the top prize Gold Lion at the 13th Wuqiao International Acrobatics Festival in Hebei Province of China from Oct. 22 to 30. 
					
					 The acrobats of the DPRK gained top marks in two rounds of performance for judgment. 
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at Hebei Art Center in Shijiazhuang City, Hebei Province, on Oct. 30. 
					
					 The festival drew acrobats from 16 countries including the DPRK, China, Russia, Mongolia, Vietnam, Australia, Germany, Bulgaria, Belarus, Sweden, France and Ukraine.

articles.title: Tudan Duck Farm Updated with Help of Kim Chaek Univ.
articles.content:
Tudan Duck Farm Updated with Help of Kim Chaek Univ.

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Researchers group of Kim Chaek University of Technology has made a great contribution to technically updating the Tudan Duck Farm.
					
					 Teachers and researchers of the university played big roles in automating and computerizing all the processes of the farm in a brief span of time.
					
					 A fermented feed production process came on-line, paying off profusely.
					
					 A process of producing methane gas from the excrement of the ducks was established and the groundwork for producing organic compound fertilizer was laid.
					
					 The ducks' pens have been rigged with the cooling and heating devices by the use of geothermal energy. A disinfection system by the use of ozone was also set up.
					
					 The researchers also computerized the production and management by Korean-style operational system.
					
					 They updated the existing equipment with the help of modern technology and settled the scientific and technological problems in the production, thus making it possible to keep the production going at a high rate.
					
					 They raised the incubation rate by modernizing the hatching room and renovated the production process of compound feed to ensure the exact and automatic calculation of the amount and quality of the feed to be mixed.
					
					 They also introduced the infrared ray sensors in processing meat and an unmanned feeding and cleaning system in one pen.

articles.title: Socialism Represents Future of Mankind
articles.content:
Socialism Represents Future of Mankind

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- It has been 17 years since General Secretary Kim Jong Il authored celebrated work "Socialism Is a Science" on November 1, 1994.
					
					 In the work, a great charter of scientific socialism in the present era, he proved the truth and invincibility of socialism in an all-round way, saying that it is as alive as ever in the minds of the people.
					
					 He affirmed that socialism, the ideal and revolutionary banner of the popular masses struggling for independence, is sure to be revived and win in the end.
					
					 The scientific accuracy of his strong affirmation has been proved in practice.
					
					 History is dynamically advancing along the road of victorious socialism indicated by him.
					
					 Towards the end of the last century the imperialists and reactionaries fussed about the "end" of socialism with regard to the events in some countries where capitalism was revived.
					
					 They even asserted historical "end" of socialism while advertising about "eternity" of capitalism.
					
					 But the new century shows the reality quite contrary to such assertion.
					
					 Capitalism, which is based on individualism and under which social relationship is mainly characterized by class antagonism and struggle, is now in the grip of the worst crisis, rejected everywhere in the world for its structural contradiction and reactionary nature.
					
					 It has found itself in more serious crisis since it sought "globalization" while clamoring about the "end" of socialism.
					
					 Neo-liberalism brought catastrophe and misfortune to various countries as it calls for "multi-party system" and "democracy" in politics and extreme liberalism and individualism in economy.
					
					 Financial liberalization pursuant to "globalization" stoked speculation and deepened financial crisis worldwide.
					
					 The U.S. and other capitalist countries of the West which pushed ahead with "globalization" are in the grip of its whirlpool.
					
					 Capitalism was revived with the U.S. imperialism as a core after the Second World War and elated in high spirit since the end of the Cold War. But it is now being shaken to its roots from its center.
					
					 The U.S. finds itself in the bottomless abyss of ruin due to the "war on terrorism" it called Third World War, just as the past fascist powers met self-destruction in the disastrous world wars against humanity.
					
					 The financial crisis which occurred in the U.S. is developing into the capitalist world crisis, sharpening class contradiction. The revolutionary advance of the oppressed working masses such as "Occupy Wall Street" demo is being intensified on a worldwide scale.
					
					 Financial supremacy, the last mainstay of U.S. imperialism, is on the point of collapse.
					
					 Illusion about the U.S. dollars has grown thinner.
					
					 The era is coming to an end when a minority of capitalist powers have exploited and plundered a majority of countries and peoples freely.
					
					 Internal contradiction and antagonism under capitalism are also getting serious.
					
					 The imperialists find a way out of the capitalist crisis in war, as evidenced by wars in Afghanistan, Iraq, Lebanon, Pakistan and other countries of the world.
					
					 Other Western powers are following in the road of ruin taken by the U.S. for "anti-terrorism war."
					
					 Socialism is greeting a new heyday after dealing a heavy blow to capitalism.
					
					 Historical turn has been made in which the scheme of the imperialists and reactionaries to stamp out socialism ended in smoke and socialism was revived and strengthened.
					
					 More than 270 political parties have struggled to defend and advance the socialist cause under the banner of the Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 It has become a main trend of the times to reject capitalism and aspire after socialism.
					
					 Absolute superiority of socialism over capitalism has been clearly proved in the revolutionary practice to overturn the old and create the new.
					
					 Socialists, working class, oppressed people and nations in different countries are holding aloft the banner of socialism, breaking the chain of capitalism.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the more capitalism reveals its reactionary nature and weakness, the deeper the world people's trust in socialism grows.
					
					 The present era is that of historical turn in which the world people are dynamically advancing toward independence and socialism while capitalism is nearing its end.
					
					 Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses, man-centered socialism, is the most scientific, advantageous and powerful one.
					
					 The history of modern Korea is that of victorious socialism in which the nation's dignity and sovereignty have been reliably defended in the do-or-die showdown with capitalism.
					
					 Great victory of Korean socialism--this is the main review of the century-long history of Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					 Future of humankind depends on socialism as a science.

articles.title: Functional Treatment Centre
articles.content:
Functional Treatment Centre

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A functional treatment centre has been built at Kim Man Yu Hospital in Pyongyang.
					
					 The centre majors in treating various kinds of sequelae.
					
					 Staffed with able doctors, it has mud, hand and heat cure facilities and wards, as well as up-to-date medical apparatuses. 
					
					 The director of the centre, Kim In Suk, told KCNA that the methods of physical training and physiotherapy draw interests of patients.
					
					 "We will improve medical service based on advanced medical science and technologies," she said.

articles.title: Taekwon-Do Hall, Centre of National Martial Art
articles.content:
aekwon-Do Hall, Centre of National Martial Art

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- In the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, a birthplace of Taekwon-Do, there is the Taekwon-Do Hall, a centre of the Korean nation's martial art.
					
					 The hall was built in a peculiar way national in form and socialist in content in Chongchun Street in Pyongyang.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il took a measure to build the hall in order to further develop the national martial art.
					
					 Inaugurated in September Juche 81 (1992), the hall has a floor space of more than 70,000 square meters. It has a main building and accessory buildings.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's calligraphic letters "Taekwon-Do Hall" are seen on the front wall of the main building. 
					
					 The hall houses a 2,400-seat gymnasium, training rooms, swimming pool, bathhouses and other welfare service facilities.
					
					 Many international and domestic tournaments, including the World Taekwon-Do Championship, have been held at the hall.

articles.title: Oun Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Oun Revolutionary Site

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Oun Revolutionary Site is situated in Oun-dong, Ryongsong District, Pyongyang.
					
					 The site is associated with rare military wisdom, superb strategy, unique commanding art and noble traits of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il stayed in the military camp in the area from August 20 to October 4, Juche 51 (1962), helping other campers arm themselves with the Juche-based military idea and tactics of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 During the camping days he led a simple life as others did.
					
					 The Korean people turned the chestnut ravine in Oun-dong into a revolutionary site to convey through generations the great feats he performed in the camp.
					
					 Preserved there are barracks, battalion headquarters, study and conversation site, lecture room, shooting range, a house where musical instruments were made and other relics.
					
					 A monument to Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities was erected in the site.

articles.title: Int'l Friendship Exhibition House
articles.content:
Int'l Friendship Exhibition House

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The International Friendship Exhibition House is located in Mt. Myohyang, one of the famous mountains of Korea.
					
					 The house, opened in August Juche 67 (1978), is a mixture of modern and national architecture. It stands in harmony with the scenic beauty of the area.
					
					 The house, with a floor space of 50,000 square meters, has a hundred and several dozen rooms.
					
					 On display in the house are hundreds of thousands of precious gifts presented to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il by foreign state and government leaders, political and public figures, overseas Koreans and south Koreans, highly appreciating their great feats for the times and humankind.

articles.title: Ho Kyun, Talented Writer of Ri Dynasty
articles.content:
Ho Kyun, Talented Writer of Ri Dynasty

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Ho Kyun (1569-1618) was a talented writer and scholar of Ri Dynasty (1392-1910) who contributed to the development of progressive literature in Korea.
					
					 Ho, born of a noble family, had studied hard from his childhood and passed a civil service examination in 1594 thanks to his family's academic atmosphere and his teacher Ri Tal's assistance.
					
					 His father, brothers and teacher were all famous for their poems and stories at that time.
					
					 Before and after 1610, he concentrated efforts on creating prose writings. The works critical of feudal rulers engaging in factional strife for their own power and interests are indicative of his progressive aesthetic view.
					
					 Typical of his works is Life of Hong Kil Dong well known among the Korean people.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Apologize Its Past Crimes against Humanity
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Apologize Its Past Crimes against Humanity

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A few days ago, a top secret document was disclosed to the effect that Unit 731 of the Japanese Kwantung Army spread fleas carrying pest germ. The unit became notorious for experimenting germ weapons on guinea pigs during the Second World War.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says this in a by-lined commentary.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists massively spread fleas carrying pest germ to meet their criminal purpose, thereby infecting 26,000 with the pathogen, according to the document.
					
					 It is something abnormal from every aspect that such hideous crime against humanity committed by Japan remained shrouded in history, a crime that should have been sternly punished by justice and the conscience of mankind, says the news analyst of the commentary.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists destroyed and burned all the evidence and relevant data at a time of their defeat in the war, for fear that their crimes might open to public. But it was more attributable to the improper stand and attitude by the Japanese authorities for their past crimes, says the commentary, adding:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are now refusing to admit, apologize and make reparation for the germ warfare and other hideous crimes against humanity perpetrated by the Japanese imperialists against people in Korea and other Asian countries.
					
					 The wrath and hatred of those people for Japan are mounting, adversely affecting the relations between Japan and those Asian countries that fell victim to it.
					
					 It is mentality common to the victimized people who underwent sufferings and pain at the hands of the Japanese imperialists that they can not get along on good terms with Japan unless it apologizes and redeems its past and they must settle accounts with it to the last. 
					
					 Japan's brazen-faced behavior to gloss over its past crimes by which it imposed acute pain on others can never be pardoned.
					
					 Japan should admit its crime-woven past history of aggression and seek ways to live as a full-fledged member of the international community.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Going against People's Mindset
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Going against People's Mindset

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Teachers Union issued a statement on Oct. 27, exposing the puppet authorities' unreasonable reshuffle.
					
					 The Ministry of Education, Science and Technology intends to replace the deputy education inspector of Seoul City with a pro-"government" person, the statement said.
					
					 This act followed the "Grand National Party's" defeat in the recent Seoul mayoral election, the statement charged.
					
					 It expressed resentment at such move to block cooperation between the newly elected Seoul mayor and the City Education Agency. This proves that the authorities are turning away from the people's mindset erupted at the Seoul mayoral election, the statement added.
					
					 It demanded the authorities stop at once the reshuffling going against the people's mindset.

articles.title: Action for Halt to Construction of Naval Base Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Halt to Construction of Naval Base Staged in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Inhabitants on Jeju Island and members of civic and public organizations, peace champions, religionists and opposition lawmakers of south Korea demanded a halt to the construction of the Jeju naval base. They staged the fifth citizens action of south Korea around the Jeju City Office on Oct. 29.
					
					 The participants accused the military authorities of hypocritically asserting that the base construction is aimed to protect the southern transport route.
					
					 It has been proved at the recent "National Assembly" session that it was also a lie when they asserted that civilians, too, will be able to use the base if it is built, they noted.
					
					 They denounced the military for unhesitatingly committing all illegal acts such as working out two different texts of the basic agreement on the construction of the naval base.
					
					 The halt to the naval base construction is the demand of not only the inhabitants of Jeju Island but other people, they said.
					
					 Then they made a demonstration march.

articles.title: GIs Commit Violence to Cabdrivers in S. Korea
articles.content:
GIs Commit Violence to Cabdrivers in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- GIs in south Korea did violence to the cabdrivers and police in Ryongsan, Seoul.
					
					 Last Sunday four drunken GIs of the 8th U.S. Army behaved rudely towards the cabman and his colleague, taking issue with taxi fee.
					
					 They also committed violence against the police officers who rushed to the scene.
					
					 This criminal case once again disclosed the true colors of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces as the root cause of all sorts of misfortune and sufferings.

articles.title: Anniversary of Secondary Education of Koreans in Japan Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Secondary Education of Koreans in Japan Marked

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place at the Korean Hall of Culture in Tokyo on October 29 to mark the 65th anniversary of the establishment of secondary educational system for the Korean residents in Japan.
					
					 Introduced at the meeting was a message of greeting sent by the Education Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 A speech was made by Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					
					 Honorary titles were awarded to officials and teachers who contributed to developing the national education of Chongryon.
					
					 A letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted there. The letter said:
					
					 The Korean residents in Japan could start the national education at a "mother tongue training center" with their will to imbue the future generations with the Korean nation's soul and dignity even in an alien land. It was thanks to President Kim Il Sung who defeated the Japanese imperialists and liberated Korea. 
					
					 The foundation of Tokyo Korean Secondary School on Oct. 5, Juche 35 (1946) signified the proclamation of the introduction of the secondary education for Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The President's historic letter "To One Million Korean Compatriots in Japan" was guidelines of struggle and a treasured sword of victory which helped Korean compatriots devotedly protect their national education, not yielding to the frantic suppression by the reactionaries of the U.S. and Japan who worked hard to obliterate the education of Koreans in Japan, the letter recalled, and went on:
					
					 The educational aid fund and stipends sent by the President to Chongryon in 1957 were life-giving water which opened the heyday for Chongryon's national education. It enabled the organization to be equipped with the regular educational system and demonstrate its honor as a worldwide model of education of overseas compatriots.
					
					 The Korean students of the third, fourth and fifth generations studying at schools at all levels are growing up to be pillars of Chongryon and the Korean community under the loving care of Kim Jong Il and benevolence of the homeland, the letter stressed.
					
					 At the end of the meeting an art performance was given to congratulate the anniversary.
					
					 That day a photo exhibition was held on the same occasion.

articles.title: Chinese Newspaper on Performance of DPRK Opera Troupe
articles.content:
Chinese Newspaper on Performance of DPRK Opera Troupe

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Phibada Opera Troupe of the DPRK gave its first performance of opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" in China.
					
					 In this regard China's Jilin Sinmun (Korean version) on Oct. 27 carried an article titled "It was a wonderful performance in which the cultures of China and the DPRK fuse into one".
					
					 The performance left a deep impression on the Chinese audience, the newspaper said, adding:
					
					 The opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" is a Korean version of a Chinese classic work adapted by the Phibada Opera Troupe last year marking the 60th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
					
					 Its premiere in China was more significant as it took place on Oct. 25, the anniversary of the CPV's entry into the Korean front.
					
					The performance fascinated more than 3,000 audience packed to the full for emotional songs and acting, sweet pangchang under the stage and beautiful Korean dance.
					
					 Not a few spectators were moved to tears, watching the last part of the performance, in particular, in which Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai turn into butterflies.
					
					 Officials and popular masses of different strata in Jilin Province enjoyed the performance, the newspaper said, and went on:
					
					 Last year the Phibada Opera Troupe made tour performances of opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" in 10 odd cities in China, including Changchun, creating a hot air of viewing Korean opera in China.
					
					 The troupe is one of the art organizations representing the highest level of Korean art.
					
					 A winner of Order of Kim Il Sung, the troupe has famous creators and artistes, including People's Artistes and Merited Artistes loved by the Korean people.
					
					 The newspaper also carried photos showing performance scenes.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed Abroad

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Nearly 100 countries and regional organizations significantly celebrated the 66th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 85th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					
					 On the DPRK's October holidays personages of different circles in various countries paid congratulatory visits to DPRK missions and laid floral baskets and bouquets before the full-length portraits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Political parties, organizations and personages of different countries, too, sent floral baskets and bouquets to DPRK embassies. Among them were the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia and the vice prime minister and foreign minister of Laos who is member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Lao People's Revolutionary Party.
					
					 The Moscow Branch of the Association for the Study of the Juche Idea was inaugurated in Russia on the WPK's birthday.
					
					 400 odd celebration events took place in more than 80 countries and regional organizations including China, Russia, Nepal, Pakistan, South Africa, Benin, Brazil, the Czech Republic, Finland and the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement.
					
					 Media of different countries gave wide publicity to the greatness of the peerlessly great persons and the WPK's exploits.
					
					 Political parties, organizations and institutions carried in their bulletins or posted on their Internet homepages articles and photos on the feats performed by the peerlessly great persons in leading the party building and the glorious history of the WPK. They included the Socialist Party of Romania, the Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna and the Kuwaiti preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Russian Party Expresses Solidarity with Korean People
articles.content:
Russian Party Expresses Solidarity with Korean People

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Workers' Party of Russia-Revolutionary Communist Party on October 26 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled the "Fraternal Korean people breaking through blockade by imperialism".
					
					 The article recalled that General Secretary Kim Jong Il successfully visited Siberian and Far Eastern regions of Russia and gave answers to questions put by ITAR-TASS.
					
					 Wide-ranging views on the regional and international issues were exchanged at the summit meeting and talks between the DPRK and Russia, the article said, adding:
					
					 The DPRK's position in the international arena will be further strengthened and the peace-loving Korean people will speed up their socialist construction under the more favorable environment.
					
					 Thanks to the socialist system established under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Korean people could achieve successes in all fields despite the imperialists' blockade.
					
					 The Communist Workers' Party of Russia-Revolutionary Communist Party extends its comradely solidarity to the fraternal Korean people in their indomitable struggle to build a prosperous and powerful socialist country.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported in Bangladesh

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Political figures of Bangladesh issued statements on October 25 and 27 as regards the answers General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave to questions put by ITAR-TASS of Russia.
					
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, said:
					
					 In his answers Kim Jong Il said the DPRK-Russia summit meeting and talks in Ulan-Ude marked an important occasion in further developing the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation to meet the desire and wishes of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 In particular, he made clear the issues of the denuclearization on the Korean Peninsula and the resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the peninsula was spawned by the U.S. posing constant threat to the sovereignty and security of the Korean people.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear deterrent was for defending its sovereignty from the U.S. undisguised nuclear threat and escalated hostile policy.
					
					 The DPRK government remains unchanged in its principled stand to denuclearize the Korean Peninsula by resuming the six-party talks without preconditions and implementing the September 19 joint statement on the principle of simultaneous actions.
					
					 We will always extend full support to the Korean party, army and people in the efforts to build a prosperous and powerful socialist country, the lifelong desire of President Kim Il Sung, and achieve the peaceful national reunification.
					
					 It is the behest of Kim Il Sung and the DPRK government's consistent stand to denuclearize the whole Korean Peninsula, said Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workersâ€™ Party of Bangladesh. We extend support and solidarity to the Korean people in the cause of its materialization, he added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised in Ukraine
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised in Ukraine

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Zavod Ukrbudmashyu Company of Ukraine posted several articles with the photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on its internet homepage on Oct. 25. 
					
					 An article titled "Great leadership for building economic power" said that thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il a strong foundation was laid for building economic power in the DPRK.
					
					 His energetic leadership is based on the extraordinary insight and profound scientific and technological knowledge, the article said, adding: Under his leadership a mass technical innovation campaign has been conducted vigorously in different fields of the national economy, bringing fresh innovations and changes with each passing day. 
					
					 There was also an article titled "Mansudae area undergoing changes".

articles.title: China's Measure to Implement Spirit of Party Plenum
articles.content:
China's Measure to Implement Spirit of Party Plenum

					 Beijing, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Publicity Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) ran a group for studying the spirit of the 6th Plenum of the 17th CPC Central Committee from Oct. 25 to 28.
					
					 The group organized training courses for publicity officials in local areas and took measures to intensify the publicity work.

articles.title: China Calls for Strengthening Struggle against Crimes
articles.content:
China Calls for Strengthening Struggle against Crimes

					 Beijing, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Supreme People's Procuratorate of China recently held a national TV telephone conference of prosecutors offices.
					
					 The conference underscored the need for prosecutors offices at all levels to sincerely study and implement the decision and orders of the central authority, grasp a new tendency of criminal activities and intensify the struggle against them.

articles.title: Military Drill Begins in China
articles.content:
Military Drill Begins in China

					 Beijing, October 31 (KCNA) -- A military drill codenamed "Vanguard-2011" began at the Queshan joint tactical training base in Jinan military district in China on Saturday. The drill will take four days. 
					
					 The several-stage drill will reportedly take place under simulated conditions of a real war, with emphasis put on reviewing and enhancing combat capabilities of motorized and airborne units.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Introducing Party Plenum Spirit
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Introducing Party Plenum Spirit

					 Beijing, October 31 (KCNA) -- A member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China (CPC) urged mass media to widely introduce the spirit of the 6th Plenum of the 17th CPC Central Committee with a strong sense of political responsibility and historic mission. 
					
					 Speaking at a national meeting on October 28, Li Changchun said that by doing so, they should give a powerful ideological support to promoting a great development and prosperity of socialist culture.

articles.title: Chinese Legislature Closes Its Session
articles.content:
Chinese Legislature Closes Its Session

					 Beijing, October 31 (KCNA) -- The 23rd session of the 11th Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress closed at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Saturday.
					
					 Adopted at the session through voting were decisions of the Standing Committee on revision of military service law, citizens' ID card law and some issues of strengthening the anti-terrorism combat.

articles.title: Chinese Police Smashes Extra-large Drug Trafficking
articles.content:
Chinese Police Smashes Extra-large Drug Trafficking

					 Beijing, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Public Security successfully smashed a drug trafficking through Internet, largest ever in the country.
					
					During the investigation, the police ferreted out 12,125 suspected criminals and uncovered 496 drug manufacture and trafficking cases.
					
					 The police also eliminated 144 drug manufacture groups, 340 drug abusing sites and 22 manufactories and confiscated 308.3 tonnes of drug.

articles.title: Russia Strives to Bolster Air Force
articles.content:
Russia Strives to Bolster Air Force

					 Moscow, October 31 (KCNA) -- Russia continues exerting efforts to bolster up its air force.
					
					 As part of the earnest efforts to rearm the units of flying corps with modern helicopters the ground flying corps of the Russian Air Force have so far received more than 100 new-type and updated helicopters this year.
					
					 Russia is expected to produce at least 1,000 helicopters, pursuant to the state arms buildup plan for 2020, said the spokesman for the Russian Air Force recently.

articles.title: CSTO Can Properly Cope with Threats: Speaker
articles.content:
CSTO Can Properly Cope with Threats: Speaker

					Moscow, October 31 (KCNA) -- The speaker of the State Duma of Russia, Boris Gryzlov, on October 26 stressed the importance of the Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO).
					
					 He expressed his view that the protocol signed in 2010 in line with the CSTO charter will take effect on the basis of complete legality at its parliamentary meeting in 2012.      
					
					 Cooperation among the member nations is very important in struggle with terrorism, illegal immigration and drug trafficking and CSTO can properly cope with all these threats, he added.

articles.title: US Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
US Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A lot of American soldiers were killed by the resistance forces' attack in Afghanistan on Oct. 29.
					
					 13 U.S. soldiers died when the bus carrying them was bomb-attacked in Kabul that day.

articles.title: US Pours Huge Fund on Intelligence Activities
articles.content:
US Pours Huge Fund on Intelligence Activities

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The United States has spent fabulous amount of funds to spy out other countries.
					
					 The U.S. State Intelligence Agency on Oct. 28 said that 54.6 billion U.S. dollars was spent for intelligence activities in fiscal 2011 ending September, an increase of about 1.5 billion dollars over the preceding fiscal year.

articles.title: Snowstorm Hits US
articles.content:
Snowstorm Hits US

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Off-season heavy snowfall in New Jersey State and other northeastern areas of the United States on Saturday caused damage.
					
					 The maximum height of snow accompanied by violent wind reached 68 centimeters.
					
					 The snowfall left 5 people dead and 4 million households without power.
					
					 Besides, roads were blocked and the rail and air services suspended, bringing traffic tie-up.

articles.title: Ex-US President Criticizes Present Administration's Policy
articles.content:
Ex-US President Criticizes Present Administration's Policy

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Ex-U.S. President Jimmy Carter criticized the Middle East policy of the present U.S. Administration.  
					
					 In a recent press interview, he said the present administration has given up the correct policy towards the Middle East, trying to support Israel in obstructing the Palestinians' effort for an independent state.

articles.title: Okinawa Gov. Calls for US to Review Futenma Relocation Plan
articles.content:
Okinawa Gov. Calls for US to Review Futenma Relocation Plan

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Okinawa Governor Hirokazu Nakaima called in a meeting with the U.S. ambassador to Japan on Friday for the United States to review the current bilateral accord on relocating a key U.S. base within Okinawa Prefecture and consider moving the base from a densely populated area of Ginowan outside Okinawa.

articles.title: Japanese Businesses Suffer Huge Losses
articles.content:
Japanese Businesses Suffer Huge Losses

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Japanese businesses met their huge group loss due to the continuous economic stagnation.
					
					 Nintendo Co., manufacturer of electronic products in Japan, said on October 27 it incurred a group net loss of 70.27 billion yen in the April to September period, citing the survey data.
					
					 Elpida, Japan's only manufacturer of DRAM chips used in computers and game systems, also logged a group net loss of 56.76 billion yen whereas Sharp Corp., Japanese electronic maker, and NEC Corp posted their group losses of 39.82 billion yen and 10.98 billion yen respectively for the April-September half.

articles.title: Bulgarian Police Seizes 42 kg Heroin
articles.content:
Bulgarian Police Seizes 42 kg Heroin

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Bulgarian police and customs officers have seized 42 kg heroin at the Danube Bridge checkpoint near Russe at the border with Romania, officials said on Sunday.
					
					 A 44-year-old Bulgarian from Karlovo and his 19-year-old daughter were arrested on the scene.
					
					 The country seized more than 300 kg of heroin in

articles.title: Dinosaur's Fossil Discovered by German Archeologists
articles.content:
Dinosaur's Fossil Discovered by German Archeologists

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- German archeologists recently discovered a dinosaur's fossil.
					
					 Nearly 10 meter-long fossil is presumed to be about 91 million years old.

articles.title: Global Casualties by Armed Violence
articles.content:
Global Casualties by Armed Violence

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Casualties by armed violence increase in different countries and regions of the world, arousing great concern. 
					
					 An international study has found everyday crime is a far greater source of armed violence than war. Authors of the 2011 Global Burden of Armed Violence report say about 526,000 people die violently every year.

articles.title: Iranian Leader Lauds Iraqi Nation's Resistance to US Pressures
articles.content:
Iranian Leader Lauds Iraqi Nation's Resistance to US Pressures

					 Tehran, October 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei on Sunday lauded resistance of all Iraqi ethnic groups to U.S. pressures at diplomatic talks. 
					
					 Ayatollah Khamenei praised the Iraqi government's opposition to giving judicial immunity to the occupying troops, and said that such efforts which would make U.S. forces leave the Iraqi territories will be considered as golden pages in the country's history. Referring to establishment of independent Iraq, the Leader voiced Iran's support for the integrated and stable Iraq. 
					
					 The Supreme Leader welcomed coexistence of various Iraqi ethnic and religious groups and said that new Iraq must be built through unity and solidarity of all groups.

articles.title: Iranian FM Denounces Israel's Barbarities
articles.content:
Iranian FM Denounces Israel's Barbarities

					 Tehran, October 31 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Iran on Friday bitterly denounced Israel for destroying a temple in east Kuds under the pretext of building a museum. 
					
					 He branded this as a premeditated move to Judaize the city of Palestine. 
					
					 He called upon the international community to take immediate step to stop Israel.

articles.title: South African Utility Gets Loan for Renewable Energy Projects
articles.content:
South African Utility Gets Loan for Renewable Energy Projects

					 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- South Africa's state-owned power utility Eskom has received World Bank approval for a 250 million U.S. dollars loan for its solar and wind power projects, the South African Press Association (SAPA) reported on Friday.
					
					 The loan will help Eskom to implement two of the largest renewable energy projects ever attempted on the African continent. Included in the project are a 100-megawatt solar power plant to be set up in Upington, in South Africa's Northern Cape province, and a 100-megawatt wind power plant in Sere, in the Western Cape province, 300 km north of Cape Town.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il concede audiencia a Liu Hongcai
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il concede audiencia a Liu Hongcai

					Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, concedio audiencia el dia 31 de octubre a Liu Hongcai, embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Popular China acreditado en la RPDC. 
					
					Asistieron a la ocasion, Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y jefe de Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento, del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Kim Yong Il y Kim Yang Gon, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios, del CC del PTC.
					
					Ademas, estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada china en Corea.
					
					Primeramente, el embajador chino transmitio al Dirigente el cordial saludo enviado por Hu Jintao, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y Presidente de la RPCh.
					
					Y le entrego el saludo de agradecimiento de Li Keqiang, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del PCCh y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la RPCh, quien hace poco realizo la visita a Corea.
					
					El embajador chino subrayo que en el presente ano en que se cumple el 50o aniversario de la concertacion del tratado sobre la amistad, la cooperacion y la ayuda mutua China-Corea, se han registrado nuevos eventos trascendentales en los vinculos entre los dos partidos y los dos paises e impulsado mas el desarrollo de sus relaciones.
					
					Apunto que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il acumulo las imborrables proezas en la consolidacion y el desarrollo de la tradicional amistad China-Corea al visitar en mayo y agosto a China.
					
					Se refirio a que Li Yuanchao, miembro del Buro Politico, miembro del Secretariado y jefe de departamento de organizacion, del CC del PCCh, Zhang Dejiang, miembro del BP del CC del PCCh y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la RPCh, Meng Jianzhu, consejero de Estado y ministro de Seguridad Publica de China y otros funcionarios responsables del Partido y el Estado de China visitaron este ano de gran significacion a la RPDC, ocasion en que se reunieron con el Dirigente       Kim Jong Il y lograron sustanciales acuerdos tras discutir profundamente con los camaradas coreanos de los importantes temas en ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos y los dos paises en la politica, la economia, la cultura y otros dominios.
					
					Liu Hongcai y otros miembros de la embajada china expresaron sincero agradecimiento al Dirigente quien aun en medio de los dias tan ocupados por dirigir al frente de la construccion del Estado prospero, les concedio audiencia otra vez, y se decidieron a esforzarse activamente por el incesante fortalecimiento y desarrollo de amistad China-Corea.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il evaluo los dinamicos esfuerzos de los miembros de la sede diplomatica china quienes hicieron gran aporte al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China.
					
					El Dirigente ofrecio una cena en honor de los huespedes chinos.
					
					La cena transcurrio en un ambiente cordial y amistoso.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim envia mensaje a Winston Spencer
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim envia mensaje a Winston Spencer

					Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 30o aniversario de la independencia de Antigua-Barbuda, el premier coreano Choe Yong Rim envio este martes un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo de ese pais, Winston Baldwin Spencer.
					
					En la misiva, el remitente desea al destinatario exitos en su trabajo para el desarrollo, la prosperidad del pais y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Dia de 7 mil millones de poblacion mundial
articles.content:
Dia de 7 mil millones de poblacion mundial

					Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar la vispera en el capitalino Hotel Internacional Yanggakdo una serie de actividades por el Dia de Poblacion de 7 Mil Millones. 
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los funcionarios correspondientes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Jerome Sauvage, coordinador permanente de la ONU y representante permanente del Programa de Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo, y otros miembros de las organizaciones de la ONU y las embajadas, acreditados en Corea.
					
					Al principio, hubo discursos de felicitacion.
					
					Los oradores subrayaron que las celebraciones de esa efemeride sirvieron de buena ocasion para que en la RPDC se conozca bien la importancia del problema de poblacion y se promueva la ejecucion del Plan de Accion de Cairo.
					
					Expresaron sus convicciones de que se fortalecera aun mas la cooperacion entre la RPDC y el Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Poblacion.
					
					Acto seguido, se realizo la exhibicion de fotos y dibujos de los ninos escolares bajo el tema de "Mundo de 7 mil millones" y fueron premiados los exponentes sobresalientes.
					
					Las pinturas exhibidas reflejan la aspiracion de los ninos escolares a un mundo pacifico, limpio y prospero y su decision de contribuir al bienestar de la humanidad.
					
					Luego, los participantes vieron un video con las grabaciones de la cancion "mundo unido" interpretada por los artistas de varios paises y hablaron con estos temas: "Publicacion del informe del estado de poblacion mundial del 2011" y "Sobre la situacion de la poblacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea".

articles.title: Minju Joson condena actitud descarada de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena actitud descarada de Japon

					Pyongyang, 1 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace unos dias, quedaron descubiertos los datos de absoluto secreto que ponen al desnudo los crimenes de la unidad no. 731 del ejercito Guandong de Japon, que durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial gano la mala fama con su experimento con seres humanos.
					
					Segun los datos, en el pasado el imperialismo japones lanzo gran cantidad de las pulgas portadoras de virus de peste para lograr su objeto criminal, con un saldo de 26 mil personas infectadas.
					
					Tales archi-crimenes antieticos de Japon, que debian ser sometidos ya a la severa sentencia de la justicia y la conciencia humana, estaban encubiertos durante largo tiempo, lo cual deviene un hecho anormal.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en su comentario individual insertado este martes y continua:
					
					Con su derrota en la guerra, el imperialismo japones, atemorizado por la revelacion de sus crimenes pasados, destruyo y quemo totalmente los datos relacionados. 
					
					Hoy en dia, los reaccionarios japoneses se oponen a reconocer, pedir disculpas e indemnizar los crimenes del imperialismo japones cometidos contra Corea y otros paises asiaticos, incluyendo la guerra bacteriologica.
					
					Debido a tal posicion, se tornan mas furiosos el rencor y odio de los coreanos y otros asiaticos al imperialismo japones, lo cual ejerce un efecto negativo a las relaciones de Japon con los paises asiaticos afectados.
					
					El sentimiento comun de los pueblos de los paises danados es que nunca se llevara una relacion amistosa con Japon que no ha indemnizado por sus crimenes y saldara cuenta sin falta con este pais isleno.
					
					Japon debe reconocer su historia agresiva manchada de crimenes y optar un camino que le posibilitara llevar una vida como integrante de la sociedad internacional.
